Reviews.Title: “nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Allison_E60795
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Boston around 2:00 am from a long drive from Philadelphia, and did not have a reservation anywhere. So when we stumbled upon Comfort Inn, we were exhausted and werent sure what to expect. Luckily, we were immediately greeted by the man at the front desk and he promptly assigned us a room and we were relaxing within 10 minutes. He was very helpful and told us to make sure we are up before 10:00 am to get the free breakfast!! The hotel room was clean and very comfortable. We had reservations for a more expensive hotel the following two days, but id have to say that I had a much more comfortable sleep at the comfort inn...go figure! breakfast was delicious and the hotel is located only a short drive to the Sam Adams brewery!! Overall a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great little getaway!”
Reviews.Author: briesy99
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a friend on Remembrance Day weekend (Nov 11, 2011) They have a free airport shuttle, they pick you up and drop you off. The front desk was great, very very friendly and helpful and they checked us in early (6 hours early as we landed on an early flight), our room was incredibly clean, modern, the hotel was clean as well. The free shuttle to the subway station was awesome, that's how we travelled the entire time we were there. Free breakfast was great, pretty standard for the hot breakfast at choice hotels chain. The breakfast room is large, plenty of food, flatscreen with the news. There's a bowling alley and brewery right around the corner and they deliver if you order food. No complaints at all, if I return to Boston I'll be staying here again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Sweet Home for three weeks”
Reviews.Author: cococantada
Reviews.Content: I was so surprised by the comfort and cleanliness as well as the caring friendliness of the staff, from the maids to the front desk. This was the last hotel we stayed in during a medical stay. This hotel was close to our daughter's home in Neponset, so we stayed here. We got a medical rate again and that included cheery maid service, shuttles to the airport and local hospitals and to the local restaurants. We felt very comfy here, especially the spacious rooms with a desk for our computer and the lovely tv ,watching the playoff games. Breakfasts had some variety, a hot egg and sausage, farina, yogurts, lots of muffins, bagels, and waffle maker. A large screen computer is available to access the internet in the lobby...also a printer. Cafe for breakfast is handy for guests. We had a good time here! It has a shuttle to the T at UMass as well, which was on time. I was happy on my birthday, to hear Mike Miano sing while we feasted on steak tips at the Freeport Inn, too. if you need a souvenir, the Philips Candy House had lots to choose from. there is also a pedestrian bridge near the property so you can walk to Stop'n'Shop or to the CVS store down the road a little. There is a laundry one street up from Stop n shop and a great Wholesale Liquidator store where we found inexpensive luggage and other items. Ti the south, there is a Chicken restaurant and a great gas station for your car, called John's Shell, I believe. To the south, you have access to I-93 and to the north, drive into South Boston via Morrissey when the traffic is bad. Freeport Road will take you to the South Bay shopping Center if the highway is slow. I feel like I know some back roads now, so i don't get stuck sitting in traffic.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Yortakire
Reviews.Content: The reason I selected this hotel for my stay was the shuttle service they offered - they picked me up at the airport and took me back & forth to Tufts Medical Center. The staff were very friendly and I felt like I was chauffered around the city. The hotel has a big grocery store across the street and two restaurants are within walking distance. A nice candy store is next door if you want to take some Boston treats home. An unusual thing happened when the fire alarm went off during the night. The hotel staff handled the event with professionalism and the fire department was there to check on the situation (was a false alarm). I would definitely stay here again if I wasn't going to rent a car. You could take their shuttle service to Tufts and then hop on the Boston subway system to go other places in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place, TERRIFIC Amenities but got no sleep”
Reviews.Author: DWhite1157
Reviews.Content: This property is really nice. We had to travel to Boston Mass Hospital & this was recommended by the hospital for us to stay. The hotel was clean, there are so many amenities, the staff was nice & the continental breakfast was not just coffee & donuts like so many other places. But for some reason I just could not sleep, the beds seemed comfortable. There were not any loud guests or partiers, but I woke every morning exhausted. Other than that the place was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “NOT as bad as people say! Take it from a local.”
Reviews.Author: txgmc
Reviews.Content: Had to stay here two weeks ago for a night because the heat in my condo went out. I live about two miles away from this property, but honestly never even acknowledged it existed despite driving by near daily! It's tucked a bit back off the road, on a curve, so it's easy to miss. FIRST off: Location. It is in the city of Boston proper, in the Dorchester section of the city. Dorchester is a working class area with a very diverse population; parts of Dorchester are undergoing serious gentrification and you can find some stunning renovated Victorians not too far from this Comfort Inn. The property is just South of downtown via I-93. It is on a major roadway, Morrissey Blvd, in a business district with some run down houses near by. This does NOT equal unsafe. It is not a fabulous place to stay if you want scenery or quaintness. Frankly, the curb appeal is awful. BUT, it is convenient to both the Interstate and public transportation -- not to mention Lambert's grocery, Dunkin Donuts, and numerous convenience stores. Lock your vehicle, yes. It's a major city, but among the safest of all major cities -- why WOULDN'T you lock your vehicle if there were valuables in it anyhow? I am at odds as to why someone would lower their rating of a property because of this. The hotel is typical Comfort Inn -- appears to be renovated within the last 5 years. My top-floor room was immaculately clean, and had a sofa and wing chair in addition to the adequately comfy queen bed. The bed was no Westin Heavenly Bed, but it was better than the one in my home. Flat-screen LCD TV had all the usual channels, and there was a micro-fridge in the room. The breakfast was in the top half of complimentary hotel breakfasts I've had. Be sure to request a room on the FRONT side of the building. Otherwise, you may hear the rumble of the Red Line subway near the rear of the hotel. The Red Line stops running at about 12:45AM and resumes service around 5AM, FYI, so you won't have any noise issues in the rear of the hotel during the middle of the night. Overall value for this Comfort Inn is an A+. Decent room, good location, convenient and good service for just over $100 a night in Boston? That is almost unheard of. I would recommend this place for budget-conscious travelers who are realistic in their expectations. It would be good for families visiting Boston universities, utilizing Boston-area hospitals, any people not afraid to use public transportation, and road-trippers looking for an overnight stopover. If you want a resort experience, look into the Seaport Hotel in the Seaport district and be prepared to pay $300 per night, $20pp for breakfast and $30 a night for parking.

Reviews.Title: “this is a good base, with amenities”
Reviews.Author: itsabouttime7
Reviews.Content: we spent a night in boston recently and after researching alot of hotels in boston i realized that prices were steep right downtown and i didn't want to chance priceline. i decided on this hotel which is 7 miles south of boston right off the interstate. it was clean, had restaurant, chocolate factory, supermarket all next door. the best part was that it ran a shuttle every half hour till 11pm to get you to the closest T station. (jfk u/mass). there was a continental breakfast and 24 hour coffee and the staff were friendly. also a business computer in the lobby if needed. free wireless in the room and also a mini fridge and microwave too... we paid $128 including taxes which i think was very good value for boston.

Reviews.Title: “Some nice perks”
Reviews.Author: HabesNJ
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel because I wanted to stay near Boston proper but save some money as well. This hotel was a pleasant surprise! Although the location was not in an "ideal" location, my daughter and I were pleasantly surprised by what this hotel had to offer. With traffic backed up on I-93 Northbound, I did not know how to return to Boston. The hotel receptionist on duty at the time recommended that we take the "T". This hotel provides a free shuttle every hour and half hour to the JFK/UMass station [Red Line] from 6am until 11pm, and parking our car was free. From the station, we picked up a "Charlie Card," activated it with a credit card, and had an easy time of traveling to and from Boston. We did have to wait for the shuttle to return to the hote,l but it was worth the time and parking fee that we would have had to pay had we driven the car. There was also a Dunkin Donuts within easy walking distance of the hotel as well as a very nice restaurant, Freeport Tavern. There is a candy shop that was even closer. We were also able to make a reservation for the airport shuttle even though we had checked out in the morning. So this was an unexpected surprise. The room itself was clean and everything worked properly. The pillows were great, 4 to each double bed, and the bed itself was pretty comfortable. The location of the hotel is not in a very nice area, but we did feel safe walking to the restaurant in the early evening and to Dunkin Donuts in the morning. Breakfast was OK except for the crowd of people from the bus tour that had stayed in the hotel. We managed to put a plate together and eat in our room. There was a decent selection of breakfast items including cold/hot cereal, yogurt, hard boiled eggs, waffles and pastries, but the scrambled eggs were not very appetizing. I would stay in this hotel again if we visit Boston again.

Reviews.Title: “OK for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: wanderinggreek
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel on an online bidding website and won a night for 95 dollars before tax. For Boston, this is a bargain. However, the hotel had some issues that would make me wish I were elsewhere for any stay longer than one night. We were given a room across from the elevator and in the back of the property literally feet from the train tracks. I could hear the elevator ringing all night long and about 6am the train running every few minutes. The bed which was supposed to be a double was tiny, as was the bathroom. The room was spotless so that made up for some of its shortcomings. We did not use the shuttle or have the complimentary breakfast. I would definitely recommend looking up the directions for getting to the hotel. It is not visible from the interstate and required a phone call to the hotel, several U turns and getting lost in the process.

Reviews.Title: “Okay if you`re deaf or hard of hearing”
Reviews.Author: carole j
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for three nights. Everything seemed fine in the reception area, but on getting to our room the doors were very loose in the frames, so it was hit or miss whether your room card worked or not. Room was basic standard room, unfortunately what wasn`t mentioned in the brochure was a busy train line only a few yards behind the hotel. Trains every other minute. The service door which the staff used, was below our room and it was contantly banged. Also when other guests left their rooms, there was banging of doors which rattled ours. The second morning we had no water due to a burst water pipe so all we were given for the day was a small bottle of water. The breakfast area was much too small to cater for all the guests. The only good thing I can say is that it was free parking. Would not recommend staying longer than one night, and only if you are hard of hearing or deaf.

Reviews.Title: “The only good thing is the shuttle when it is on time...”
Reviews.Author: Chantal V
Reviews.Content: ALl hotels in Boston are expensive because of the taxes on top but 130 bucks for a room where the carpet had seen better days and the plugs were all naked with wires hanging is still too expensive. The breakfast is alright and complimentary, the receptionists are not too unfriendly. THe complimentary "High Speed" internet is slower than using a 56K modem. If you drive, I guess it's good to have a free car park with a shuttle to the nearest T station just 4 stops from downtown Boston or if not one to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Poor - I would not recommend it”
Reviews.Author: dec121
Reviews.Content: waited 1hour 10 mins for shuttle from airport - took 3 phone calls no water next morning for shower as mains pipe burst (in fairness this could happen in any hotel) nevertheless it did do anything to add to our initial experience. coffee machine in room was not working - took two reports to front desk to have this replaced one of the girls on the front desk had a very ignorant attitude - will contact the hotel directly with regard to this individual - as there is no need for her bad manners Our experience left us feeling the hotel needed a good shake up

Reviews.Title: “Really appreciated the shuttle service”
Reviews.Author: rushrushNM
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located right next to the train track, but it did not bother us. We stayed 4 nights and will probably stay again, the shuttle service to the train station made it handy, and accessible.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad at all!!”
Reviews.Author: jazjudd
Reviews.Content: After reading many other reviews on tripadvisor I was scared to stay here! However, I was pleasantly surprised. We had an early morning flight out of Logan and for $140 we could sleep there, take the free shuttle at 3am, and leave the car for a week! How can you beat that? Our room was on the top floor and we didn't hear anything outside of our room! The room was nicely decorated, had a flatscreen tv, and was clean. We were in a handicap accessible room and the bathroom was huge! We loved the shower! Also, stop n shop is right across the street in case you forget anything. The shuttle to the airport was on time..and actually was waiting for us, both ways! No complaints at all!

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: PDRocha
Reviews.Content: You get what you pay for. Not much to say about it. Breakfast it's ok. Hotel in general is clean. If you have trouble sleeping, the train station on the side won't be helpful. Far from downtown.But like I said before, It's ok for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced for a dump”
Reviews.Author: amyliajeff
Reviews.Content: The room was extremely small, the bathroom door was one foot from the bed, there were dried 'splashes' of who knows what on the ceiling, there were boogers on the wall, the bathroom door had to be shoved with full body weight to close, the 'courtesy shuttle' was never on time or there were way too many people to fit in the van and you would have to wait another hour to be picked up. When you did get a ride it was terrifying, it was like they were driving for NASCAR. The walls were paper thin, I could actually hear the conversations in the next room. The train is behind the hotel and you got the joy of hearing it every fifteen minutes, and it was extremely loud. We heard doors to other rooms open and slam shut all night long. If you want to pay too much, lack of sleep, and be late to anything, stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Did the job”
Reviews.Author: KTurc
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with friends while on a road trip through New England. The staff was very friendly and the facilities were clean. The beds were comfy and breakfast was alright, just very crowded- we opted to eat outside, but had to put up with the smoke from smokers because of it. Our A/C was a little tempermental in the room and at one point the cover fell completely off! (Easily fixed but surprising all the same.) We enjoyed having the sink area outside of the bathroom. The shuttles to JFK/UMass train station were great. Overall an average hotel, a reliable place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “One Night stand”
Reviews.Author: BruceMoguls
Reviews.Content: We needed a place to sleep for one night in Boston, and this was the cheapest place that seemed like it would be decent, clean and safe. We were pulling in late and leaving early. There are a variety of comments about the location, but if you have a car, it is only a 5 minute drive to Fanueil Hall and Quincy Market. It is not walking distance to anything worthwhile, so that is likely the source of the complaints on this site. Our main "pro" for this place is that it was reasonable by Boston standards, was a national brand, so we knew what we were getting, and the location, while not ideal, fit the bill for us. The main cons: The lobby was really noisy when we checked-in around 1am. The A/C in our room (it was 100+ degrees!) was super loud, really bothersome

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel outside of the city with convenience access to the MBTA”
Reviews.Author: WGRoper
Reviews.Content: The hotel is ok, nothing fancy but clean. We won this one with a bid of $100 per night on Priceline. Lucky for us, there is a shuttle to the JFK/UMass train station every half hour, that made it very easy to get into the heart of Boston. The continental breakfast is tolerable, but the crowd is not. There's a Dunkin' Donuts within a few minutes walk, we chose that over the free breakfast a couple of days during our stay. The family that owns the hotel also owns several other properties within a block or two and they push those businesses heavily on you. We ate dinner at the Freeport Tavern one evening and it was very good, although the live music was cheesier than anything I've ever heard in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Great convenience and services”
Reviews.Author: travelfansusa
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Comfort Inn for a convention at the Boston Convention Center and were impressed by the shuttle service. It ran every hour and dropped us right off at our convention center. Pick up was reliable as well. They also offered drop off and pick up from the train station which was great if we wanted to go out in the city. Breakfast was a good convenience when we were on the go in the morning. There was also wireless internet which was helpful as well as a computer and printer in the lobby. The location of the hotel itself is a little out of the way, but the access to the city via shuttle makes it worthwhile. Price was also reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Not nearby a whole lot, but nice and friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: CRL_17
Reviews.Content: I liked the hotel itself. It was clean and nice. The staff worked with us on arranging our rooms to be on the same floor as we were w/ a group. They give you fresh baked cookies upon arrival, that were yummy as well. The down side is taking the transit system to get anywhere around the area, unless you're driving in Boston. It takes a long time and is tedious. There wasn't really anything, restaurants, site seeing, bars, etc near the hotel itself. The transit stop was approx 1/3 - 1/2 of a mile from the hotel so it wasn't that bad to walk there.

Reviews.Title: “Value for Money but too far off”
Reviews.Author: Sudisha
Reviews.Content: This hotel is near Quincy not near quincy market..........I ha thought these were the same. The hotel is far off from down town & I would suggest spending more money & staying in downtown instead. rooms were clean & hotel was avg.Not much options for breakfast. Its about 20 mins by schuttle(which runs every 30 mins from hotel) to the nearest train station at Umass and it takes ~20 mins by train to reach downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Good Enough”
Reviews.Author: soze031
Reviews.Content: Bed was hard, Service was Nice. Its a Comfort in so you can't compare it to the other Hotels I stayed in but it wasn't bad at all. I don't think the rate was fair considering a night at a Westin is $189 and this was $150... But The hotel is in Dorchester which is 15 mins from South Station and the down town area so Its a good location to be at to save a few bucks from the down town hotel prices.

Reviews.Title: “80/20”
Reviews.Author: gknightNorthCarolina
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews for this location prior to reserving and they were quite helpful and for this reason, I am writing one! Thus, my greatest hope is that the hotel administrators really take advantage of these reviews to increase satisfaction if there appears to be consistency with reviews. The hotel is cool (i.e., I would stay again)! However, to hold true to a NON SMOKING facility, it would be ideal to move the smokers from the ENTRANCE of the hotel, so UNATTRACTIVE as well as not considerate for those having to enter through the web of smoke that travels into the facility. Okay, the staff, they were so unorganize and all had a different response to the same question which got rather frustrating. I don't know whether it's the Boston climate, but they were not cordial, particularly if questions are asked. But, please ASK QUESTIONS, b/c they don't offer pertinent info like if you plan to use the shutter upon departure back to the airport, you have to sign up early (it doesn't work like the every 30 minute shutter). It appears that they need a collaborative training because otherwise it would appear the the turnover might be enormous. The room was cool (tv, local menus, local contacts, an automatic light @ entrance into the room, comfortable bed, etc), however the flushing of the commode is rather slow, the noise can be intensive and the internet has peak hrs of slowness. They offered good breakfast, but don't look to eat in the dining area unless you get there very early b/c it's was always overly crowded. It would be ideal to knock a wall down for greater accomodation, but that might be a hidden agenda for the size:). The shutter was consistent (i.e., every 30 minutes) and the drivers were nice and helpful. The eating facilities were walking distance and great! Enjoyed both, Freeport with the lobster and bowling place with the wings! Thus, there's a supermarket directly across the street, I also utilized it! The 7/11 convenient store is walking distance as well. Now, in closing, please check your charges b/c I was overcharged even after specifying with staff. Unfortunately, I had to get as rude as they were b/f I could be heard and this in my opinion, is quite unneccessary for a hotel that makes emphasis on "Satisfaction Guaranteed," this can be a difficult to task to uphold if you aren't trained and a people's person which both were evident. I am still waiting to see if and how long it will be to get the finance resolved (i.e., they are still holding unnecessary money on my account) and I'm back home. But on a good note, after an "intensive" (i.e., he raised his voice with me and I returned the exact communication) face to face front desk communication with the general manager, I did reap an immediate respond towards resolving the matter and my hope is that it will be respectfully carried out! Thanks for allowing me to share my experience at Comfort Inn and I would definitely stay again b/c I know exactly what to look for, although, I really don't think it should be such a paranoia stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: craftbeerlover52
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed overnight here. The place was nice, clean, comfortable and the staff was friendly. They upgraded us to a suite at no additional cost. They had convenient, free shuttle service, a fitness room with pool and a free breakfast. What more more could you ask for at a reasonable price for the Boston area?

Reviews.Title: “Absolute Chaos”
Reviews.Author: lattieb
Reviews.Content: The front desk for the this hotel is the worst. Most of them are rude and uncooperative. Issue #1. When i got to the hotel on 5/21 at 12 midnight i found that they cancelled my hotel room with no e-mail or anything sent to say it's cancelled. The reason the desk clerk gives is they went to charge my credit card for the room at 4:00 pm and the card was decline. My response is why are you charging me when i have not even checked in as yet. Your guarantee policy on line is that I have until 7 am the next morning to check in before you charge me. Of course no real explanation is given and now they are sold out they have no rooms available. So now i have to get back on the shuttle bus and trek over to there sister hotel the Ramada who has one room left lucky me. Finally by 2 am in the morning i was able to get into a room. Issue #2 The front desk is terrible they are so unprofessional and rude. This will be my last time staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Only good thing was the location”
Reviews.Author: mg978
Reviews.Content: stayed for a nearby weddding. Room was small; and we were denied a change to another type of room when requested. Train felt like it was coming in our room. No iron. TV remote didnt work -twice. Dining area filthy! tables not cleaned after use. Bowling lanes and other shops are not attached as website leads one to believe; they are about a 5 minute walk . Then, to top it all off; they charged us twice and said we checked in the day before we actually did!! Wish we had stayed elsewhere..and definitely will not go back.

Reviews.Title: “Good service but noisy room”
Reviews.Author: VisitNiagara
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights just before Easter. A group of teenage students was on the same floor and were so noisy I barely slept. They converged on the breakfast room and made it nearly impossible to get anything to eat or drink. The second night was a bit quieter. Rooms are dated and worn but clean. The shuttle to the T station made getting into Boston easy. We had dinner at the Tavern just a short walk from the hotel and it was lovely. The staff were very helpful and friendly. If you're looking for a convenient location near Boston at a good price then this is the place. It's closer to Quincy than Boston (near the JFK Library - south of Boston) I would go back again but ask to be placed on a floor where students group weren't staying.

Reviews.Title: “Friendliest and most accomidating staff I've ever seen!”
Reviews.Author: falconff399a
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Boston from Colorado for my 3 year old grand daughter to have surgery. After being disharged from 5 weeks at the Children's Hospital we needed somewhere to stay while we made reasonable accomidations to get back home. We travel quite a bit and stay in many hotels, and never have I had the prompt, pleasent, high quality service that the staff at this hotel provided. It certainly was a pleasent suprise and made our very stressful stay much more comfortable than we had expected!

Reviews.Title: “Out dated, Over piced and Dirty!!!”
Reviews.Author: Mymonree
Reviews.Content: This hotel is so out dated. The window in my room is cracked. The hotel lamp shades are white w/ brown spots. You can hear the doors close and the train sounds like it's right in your room. The breakfast area is sooo small. The parking lot cannot accomodate the guest for the night. REFUND..Can anyone tell me how to get my money back?? Dirty, Unkept and hallways smells...awful odor. Feel like a truck stop hotel.

Reviews.Title: “If you like hearing trains all night, this is the place for you.”
Reviews.Author: kaymarie1983
Reviews.Content: One of the worst stays I have had in Boston. Upon arrival, front desk associate was polite and courteous, but not very welcoming. The room was large and basic. The first thing I noticed ( heard) was the subway. The tracks were right at my window level and very noisy with trains passing by every couple of minutes. I could not hear the TV when they were passing. I went down to ask about moving rooms, but the staff seemed preoccupied with personal chitchat. I did find out the hotel was only 1/2 full, but they could not move me into a different room (?). The next really big annoying issue is with the motion sensor lights.. great idea, but once they came on, they could not be turned off. A few times during the night, I must have rolled over or adjusted my blanket and switched them on. They stayed on for about 10 minutes each time. Couple that with the noise from the train, I had no sleep that night. Breakfast was ok, nothing special but adequate.Housekeeping started their rounds fairly early and talked very loudly in the hallways to each other. I checked out the next morning, a few days earlier than expected. Staff could not have cared less. One good thing about this hotel is the shuttle drivers are very friendly and prompt. It is not as convenient as mentioned on website, (90 minutes from Kenmore station to the hotel) and I'm not sure how nice the area is. The shuttle took some back roads to the hotel that were a little "sketchy" which made me uncomfortable to walk to the neighboring restaurants for dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: kcroxbury
Reviews.Content: Hotel is great for us. Close to Freeway and family. Bowling alley and restaurant Close (Like next door). Family loves it and will return

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Good Value”
Reviews.Author: BigfootMN
Reviews.Content: Having read some of the reviews concerns about noise, we were a bit wary. But when we checked in, the staff was extremely helpful and made sure we were in a front room. They weren't particularly busy and put us in a mini-suite. And any concerns about noise were unfounded, at least as far as we were concerned. When we mentioned that we were looking at tours of Boston, the staff informed us that one of the trolley tours could pick us up at the hotel. That worked great and we didn't need the our car for the next couple of days. If we had instead elected to use the "T", the hotel also provided a free shuttle to the T station a couple of miles away. The only negative we encountered was a slow internet connection.

Reviews.Title: “Average Stay/Close to airport”
Reviews.Author: 2kdz_momma
Reviews.Content: We used the Comfort Inn as the park, fly and stay! Which is a great service. They do have a shuttle that will bring you to the airport but it goes out only on the hour, which was a let down to us. Not a big deal, just required us to get up a little earlier! They do not have cots or pack and plays available at this hotel, we requested when when we made our reservation and were never told that they didnt have any at the hotel. No biggie again our kids are young we made them a bed on the floor, they enjoyed it! Nothing fantastic about the hotel, just an average place! Easy check in, and out, quiet rooms! Free wifi!!!

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel but too far out of town”
Reviews.Author: goodosdorset
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights as first leg of a tour. Very nice hotel but much too far out of town. Rooms very good, breakfast free and very good, free internet, all in all a very nice hotel if you are using it as a base for the airport or if you have your own car.

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel but to far out of town”
Reviews.Author: sweetbum
Reviews.Content: This was our first stop on our tour and was at the comfort inn for three nights, it was a good job we was on a coach tour as this hotel is a bit to far out of Boston but it is near to logan airport. The hotel was clean and comfortable with a free continential breakfast. Rooms where large with two queen size beds, and a free inter-net access in the lobby also they have a indoor swimming pool.

Reviews.Title: “Very Average”
Reviews.Author: TorontoTimTim
Reviews.Content: Average, average, average. That just about sums the place up. There is nothing good or bad about this hotel. Breakfast was ok. Front desk was ok. Appearance was ok, but carpets could have the stains removed. We had no problem with noise, internal or external. We stayed there because there was free transportation from our trolley tour operator, to/from Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Not Up To Usual Standards”
Reviews.Author: FrequentVirgin
Reviews.Content: Booked here for the last few days of our 3 week New England & Niagara vaccation after spending a couple of wonderful nights at the Comfort Inn & Suites Rhode Island. Had a discount voucher which was not much of a discount but they would only honour it for 2 of our 4 nights, it was very expensive compared to RI and none of the ameneties or quality either. We were given Rm 313 (asked to change if given this room) a single size room with a double bed - not 2 queens or the king we had come to expect, Pokey outdated bathroom and generally a very manky feel to the room, then there was the noise of the trains.... I said to my partner I'd put up with it for the 2 discounted nights but there was no way I was staying in this room once the discount expired. But In the end we had to go beserk to get moved after one night. No maid service after our first night despite the fact our room was unoccupied between 9 am & 8 pm and when we made enquiries the female receptionist told us they only did the room every other day - very odd never come across that excuse before. So I started asking other guests because you cannot believe you have actually comprehended what a person of authority has told you. And sure enough it was a lie. But when we spoke to a different receptionist he spoke to us like we were lying, if there is one thing you don't do to me it is infer I'm a liar - big No No - where is the customer service? Anyway after being treated like something he stepped in he did give us a much better room on the fifth floor but why did we have to have all that grief? We have a complaint, you resolve it - it's your job, you do not pick a fight with us - you're in customer service not 'these people are an inconvenience and spoil my day by making me do my job'

Reviews.Title: “Did not meet my expectations, but adequate for two nights.”
Reviews.Author: CarrigeenYorkshire
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Boston by coach and picked up a taxi, which had great difficulty finding the hotel. I was disappointed the hotel was so far out of the city (expensive taxi ride!!) and the effort of getting the shuttle and train into town on our two days was a pain, parrticularly when the suttle was full and we had to wait for the next one(a common occurance, by other travellers comments!). Following other Trip Advisor tips we asked for a quiet room, and were given one down the far end of the ground floor, which was great. Not a lot to say about the room, which was comfortable, but basic. Breakfast was great, and offered a big variety, but I advise get down early if you want cooked..... it runs out fast! Free coffee all day. Staff were very pleasant and tried to help out if there was any issues. For meals, it well worth worth walking under the bride and going further on than the Ramada,.... very good grill and restaurant further on, great prices. (Cen't remember the name). Free interenet in the hall way, but busy and you may have to wait.

Reviews.Title: “It is comfortable to in”
Reviews.Author: naveenkr
Reviews.Content: "Good stay" I booked this hotel for my conference visit in Boston. This hotel has good facility and nice staff. Breakfast was quite good and room service was great. It has courtesy shuttle facility from hotel to near by stations and airport. I liked it,

Reviews.Title: “Too many missing services”
Reviews.Author: stefinicious
Reviews.Content: Positives: - cleanliness - complimentary breakfast was great - house cleaning staff was very friendly and polite - check-out time was 12:00 (most hotels are 11:00), so I felt less rushed in the morning - coupons for discounts/free items at local businesses, such as free fudge and a free round of bowling - allowed guests to use the pool at the Ramada (5 minute walking distance) since this hotel didn't provide a pool - exercise facility - free shuttle to subway stations - the desk attendant discounted our stay because of the problems we had (see below) Negatives: - our reservation was for a room on the 5th floor but we were given a room on the 1st floor - our reservation was for a queen size bed but our room contained 2 twin beds . . . is this college? I have to share a twin bed with my boyfriend? apparently. - our reservation was for a room which included a refrigerator but our room did not include one. The front desk said they ran out but would put us on the list to get one first thing the next morning. We never received this fridge for the 3 days we were there. I had to throw out food and milk, which I specially brought because we would have a fridge. - the wireless internet did not work at all during our 3-day stay. my boyfriend has a master's degree in computer science, so it's not like we were clueless about how to use the internet; it didn't work. - the cleaning staff never visited our room on our 2nd day; we were out for the entire day so there was no reason to skip over us. however we called the front desk and they immediately brought us new towels and cups.

Reviews.Title: “Not that bad but not good value”
Reviews.Author: gg123456
Reviews.Content: I ended up staying here because I was trying to book a different hotel thru priceline - my gamble did not pay off and priceline put me in this hitel for $120 a night at the height of the summer. The hotel was completely booked to my surprise. The cons- they tried to put my wife and I in a tiny room with a small bed (i think its called a double but was only ig enought for 2 kids- no way 2 tall adults could share that bed comfortably). I immediately called reception and threatened to walk out and demand a refund if they did not find a room with a larger bed for us. After initially telling us they had no rooms as they were full(they were full), they somehow managed to find a room for us which was ready in about 20 mins. This was a normal motel type room with 2 beds in it. This is a no frill hotel and it is a pain to get to because it is about 5 miles outside town and on an annoying highway. Breakfast was mediocre but many hotels do not provide free breakfast. Internet was not fast enough to watch videos and even email use was slow. at least internet was free. Many hotels charge. Free shuttle to subway was nice, though shuttles can only accomodate 10 passengers and we had to wait for a second shuttle to come and bring us back to hotel as the first shuttle could not accomodate all the waiting customers. Does it deserve to be ranked practically last on TA? I really doubt it. Could I have found an equal or better hotel more centrally located for $120 a night? Im pretty sure I could have.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel outside central Boston”
Reviews.Author: ilovetoshop
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a no frills hotel. Very basic rooms (ours has 2 double beds for 4 people). Bed was comfortable and clean. Bathroom was small but clean. My only complaint about the room was that it has paper thin walls. You can hear other people's "business" thru these walls. They have a small breakfast area near the lobby that serves buffet breakfast. Food was ok, choices were limited. Hotel lobby was small. The price was a little steep for a hotel outside central Boston. If you're coming to explore Boston and want to stay in this hotel, try getting the Beantown Trolley tour. The trolley can pick you up at the hotel and drop-off after the tour. That's what we did. Next time, I will try another hotel in central Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the stay”
Reviews.Author: WorldTraveler783
Reviews.Content: This hotel does not live up to the Comfort Inn brand. The rooms were old and outdated. The cleaning people left there cleaning supplies in the room. The shower did not drain properly. There was train right behind the hotel running all night. The business center computer does not work properly. The staff is not all that helpful. They advertise restaurant and pool, but these are not at this hotel. Its at a neighboring hotel down the road. They say they have complimentary shuttle but they charge you a $5 a day service fee on your bill. The hotel needs to be re branded as "Boston Budget Inn". I would not stay here again and will not recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Its a place to crash, but dont expect anything to impress you.”
Reviews.Author: reentselite
Reviews.Content: stayed 4 nights on the 2nd floor. sound could be heard from other rooms, and you could hear the chime in the elevator, 4 rooms down. after housekeeping cleaned room after 1st night, it was cleaner then when we checked in. Parking is a mess, as well as the one way street it sits on. People do not know how to drive in boston, but being a lead foot, I adjusted quickly.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Valquiria
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Boston for a night in Comfort inn. The staff was very friendly and professional. The room was comfortable and very clean. The only thing that I didn't like is that the plates and cutlery were plastic. It is not pleasant or practical to eat the breakfast in those plates.

Reviews.Title: “Great Prices, Wonderful Service with Tasty Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Wiggypants
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel, one of the best we came across while in the US. Service is excellent and the hotel has a free convenience shuttle which will take you to the airport or the train station, location is a little away from the city but with the shuttle service to the train station getting into the city is easy and Boston public transport is the best and easiest we have ever come across. Rooms were really clean and nice. Free Wi-Fi came in handy with keeping in contact with home. This hotel really did enhance our stay in Boston and in the future we will return to enjoy all it has to offer in the summer. Would recommend to everyone especially to those on a budget (but don't wanna feel like it)!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, very expensive in this time of the year”
Reviews.Author: infectbnl
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend decided to take a trip to Boston and it was a pretty spontaneous decision. Did not book a hotel. Thought we could find one cheap and fast when we get there. MAJOR MISTAKE. Do not go to Boston before you make a hotel reservation. It was a nightmare. All the hotels were booked. One taxi driver told us that the Comfort Inn might have rooms. Guess what ? They had only one room left (that's what they said) and charged us something like 240 USD for one night :). That is a lot for a three star hotel. Maybe the season was pretty busy, but still 240 USD :) for a Comfort Inn. We did not have any choice cause it was already passing midnight so we paid the price. The room was OK, nice view of downtown Boston from distance. Location is good if you are with a car, next to a major highway. Breakfast was also OK, typical 100 USD per room per night hotel breakfast but not for 240 :D. Would never make that mistake again to go on a trip without booking in advance. I had my lesson.

Reviews.Title: “very loud trains”
Reviews.Author: evan7
Reviews.Content: Besides being the noisiest hotel I've ever stayed at, the place was not up to even Comfort Inns standards. Definitly avoid staying on the railroad tract side of the hotel- it's amazing how often the trains go by.

Reviews.Title: “Find someplace else if possible”
Reviews.Author: sharona1120
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through Sleep Park Fly for a pretty decent rate considering we were spending the night, leaving our car there for 6 days and being shuttled to and from the airport. The hotel was easy to find and easy to check into. However, upon check in, we were given a letter stating that the hotel was obligated by the Boston Police Department to inform us of the increased break-ins in the area. We had to sign a release form stating that the hotel was not responsible for the damage to our vehicle while parked on their property! Fortunately our car was fine but that wasnâ€™t a very comforting way to start our vacation. The room was ok at best! Kinda out dated and the plumbing was awful!! While taking a shower or even just brushing your teeth, the water was backing up into the sink and tub and then took forever to drain out! As for the bowling alley, bar, restaurant, and candy store that is supposedly located in the hotelâ€¦..its not! Its down the street and around the corner. We had to walk under an overpass and cross a highway to get there!! We didnâ€™t spend much time at this hotel; we caught our shuttle at 4am. FYI the shuttle only picks up on the hour. I donâ€™t think we will be returning to this hotel. There are others in the area that you can look into.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: GatorNana
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel upon our arrival in Boston at Logan Airport. The front desk staff were friendly, helpful, and informative for us as first-time visitors to the area. They provided us with information about their shuttle van and the subway - even recommended a good place for lunch downtown and how to find the Freedom Trail. The rate was a bit high we thought for a Comfort Inn but it was completely clean, well-furnished, and so was perfect for our purpose. We are from Florida so the rate could just be "culture shock". We enjoyed a well-stocked complimentary breakfast buffet. We also were pleasantly surprised at the menu choices and quality of the food when we had a late-night dinner at the restaurant, Margarita's. The location was nothing to speak of but was very close to our car rental office so we didn't have to brave driving very far in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: ConnieRC
Reviews.Content: I was disappointed in my selection of a hotel. I used priceline to get a good deal on a hotel and entered in I was willing to stay in South Boston and this hotel came up. It lists its address as Boston but it's actually located in Dorchester (a Boston suburb). Their website said that the local T station was only 1.5 miles away but it's actually 2.1 miles by foot or car (read the small print). We arrived at 10 a.m. on a Saturday and was hoping to take the shuttle to the T station to catch the T into Boston. We waited for 10 minutes and when the shuttle arrived it said it only had 2 available seats. Well there were 20 people waiting. The driver said the next shuttle would be in 20 minutes and again would only fit 12 people. The shuttles service both the Comfort Inn and the Ramada. So when it looked like we would never get to the station before noon I asked the man at the front desk how far the T station was and if it was walkable (keep in mind I have small children who were with me). He said it was only about 3/4 of a mile down the road and it was walkable. So we decided to walk. Well it was quite a long walk and when I clocked it with my car the next day I found out it was actually 2.1 miles away and the walk involved walking through parking lots (again I have small children). Needless to say we ended up driving into Boston every day since the shuttle service was a nightmare, not convenient at all. The hotel is also not located in a great place. When you check in they give you a hand out that says they have had recent car break-ins and to remove all electronics from your vehicle. They even go as far to say to clean the area were your GPS suctions onto your window so the potential thief doesn't realize you have a GPS. It surely didn't leave us with the warm and fuzzys. The train also runs directly behind the hotel so avoid getting a room on the backside of the hotel. We stayed in one on the front side facing the parking lot so I'm not sure how much the train is heard from within one of the backside rooms. It's a very small hotel with not a lot of amenities. I surely didn't pay a lot but I guess sometimes you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Crazy night!”
Reviews.Author: 93ruby
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and our daughter stayed for one night with parking on April 9th. We had an early flight and the hotel included parking for 10 days. There was 3 busloads of angry hockey fans that came in late and were very loud all night. No sleep was had, but the hotel did make it up to us and we were left happy. The shuttle service was great and I would do this again.

Reviews.Title: “A fine place for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: njyogini
Reviews.Content: I just spent one night here at this hotel which is in Dorchester, not Boston- I don't know why they list it as Boston- but it's only minutes away. For the price, it was quite comfortable. I requested and received a small fridge- and there is a Stop and Shop right across the road so you have a place to store your munchies. The breakfast was great- hot eggs and french toast where I was only expecting the typical Continental. If you're here as a tourist, this is the way to go- the prices in town are outrageous! Oh yes, the wireless internet works!

Reviews.Title: “Not Just Good, Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: BusinBee
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with a few of my colleagues. I come to Boston about twice a month for business and I had the benefit of staying here last week. The hotel offers a free shuttle to and from the airport and another that goes to the local train station. The staff was extremely welcoming and courteous and the services, especially the free breakfast, were an added bonus for the price that we paid. Another bonus was the 24 hour "family fun center" which had a restaurant, over 40 bowling lanes, pool tables and an arcade. Although my colleagues and I didnt spend much time in the arcade, we thoroughly enjoyed bowling and having a few drinks after attending meetings all day. There is also another restaurant and full bar located a short walk down the street, the food was excellent! There was also a candy shop that makes their own candy but I haven't tried that, although I did see it was rated one of New England's top 10 chocolatiers. Overall this is my secret spot to stay in Boston and actually have money left over to spend at night.

Reviews.Title: “The best part of staying at the Comfort Inn”
Reviews.Author: duboce
Reviews.Content: The best part of staying at the Comfort Inn was coming back to this web site and reading the bozo review (mostly from Europeans) who have criticized and posted here. I spent 1 week and would like to tell you about it. I arrived in Boston, got my Hertz Rental car and drove with map instructions to the hotel. I had a difficult time finding the place because the area has had major highway construction and rerouting of lanes. The work is finished but it really takes a skilled driver to find the place the first few times. The street in front of the hotel is divided and you can cross either by foot over the bridge, or on the street (dangerous to do so) if you want to go to the supermarket across the street. Use the bridge, save yourself. Check in was fine and my room was above expectations. I used the shuttle the following day to go to the airport to retrieve people arriving from Japan and coming back was fine except that on using the shuttles, I noticed that each driver had a different way to get to and from the hotel. Unless you really need a car, don't bother renting one. Follow the instructions in the lobby and use the shuttle to the T (subway stop) pay $2 and go in town. Its easy, fast and you don't have to deal with the car. Dining: The hotel has a free continental breakfast. There is a microwave in the dining room and you can use it for the oatmeal or hot cereal, hot chocolate, etc. or microwave your own food (at any hour you wish). The dining room provides make your own waffles, scrambled eggs, the usual cakes, toast, rolls, juices. Its not a big dining room but the European tourists that overloaded the hotel thought they were at a sidewalk cafe and the lines waiting to eat were annoying due to many people sitting and reading a paper while having breakfast. Generally it is sufficient, clean, and filling. There is no other dining option at the hotel. You can walk about 1 block to the bowling alley where there is an Italian sandwich shop and pizza, adequate but nothing great. Just okay from my point of view. Next to it is that Phillips Candy shop. At $23 a pound they don't give out samples and the employees act as if they are the owners of the place and keep count of every item. Next to it is the restaurant/bar. Its worth going to. They have a good menu, its like an English pub, many beers and cocktails, good service, the waitresses are patient and helpful especially in dealing with the tourists who did not speak English. I would go back there again even if not staying at the hotel. 4**** for the restaurant. The pool at the Marriot is available for use but I never saw anybody using it. You would have to carry your suit and towel there, walking 1 block or driving over there if you want to go for a swim. The noise factor from the T is not that bad. Maybe it is if you are in the rear of the hotel but the front was quite nice and there is plenty of free parking. The rooms have an iron and an ironing board and there is a laundry on the first floor. You can wash and dry clothes and the washer has an automatic soap dispenser which adds soap and fabric softner so you don't have to worry about obtaining it at all. Some of the staff on the front desk were not too bright and gave me directions which caused me to get lost while looking for a Target store. Others on the front desk are quite competent and accomodating. You can sit in the lobby or in the front of the hotel and have a cigarette and read a newspaper. Most of the guests were in and out all day long. This hotel is not really close in at all but the alternative is staying in central Boston at a much higher rate and generally in a dumpy downtown area. Boston is congested and not that clean in my opinion. The cleaning staff at the Comfort Inn did a very good job, were thorough and efficient. I am always amazed at the slobs who criticize here. Just take a walk through the hallways and look into the rooms that the maids are cleaning. Clothes on the food, bottles all over and debris in the room. These are the slobs that call everything filthy and post it here. Take a good look at the full length mirror and see who the slobs really are. I notice that many Europeans are critical when writing reviews. The very same people who camp in downtown areas in European parks and wear lederhosen or sweat outfits to fancy restaurants seem to think they are in Monte Carlo (playing the lowest denomination slot machine). I would recommend the hotel and would stay there, had no complaints for the 7 days we were there. Thank you .

Reviews.Title: “Terrible stay at the Comfort Inn Boston!!”
Reviews.Author: phoenixpa
Reviews.Content: This was probably one of the worst hotels I have ever stayed at. First it wasn't very clean, our bed sheets were stained with blood as well as our pillowcases, didn't even look like the sheets were changed from the previous guests that were in the room. The hallway had a funny odor, then our internet never worked in our room, nor did our iron and the staff wasn't helpful at all. Also, the area is not that great that it is in either. Next night stayed at the Homewood Suites in Cambridge, and that is a much nicer area. Stay away from this hotel.....

Reviews.Title: “good value, but with caveats”
Reviews.Author: marieatta_pman
Reviews.Content: There is nothing written in the other reviews taht i would disagree with. Yes it is close to teh T and a busy street, and planes fly right overhead. The shuttle to the T station/airport is crowded. The restaruant and pool are not on site but at the adjoing Ramada, owned by the same people. But consider that Boston is usually pretty expensive for hotels, espcially any closer to teh city center. I paid $134 a night, which was far cheaper than other properties closer in, and i was still easily able to get to where i wanted to go. Plus the free parking saves you the $20+ you'd pay downtown. If the weather is nice, and you dont mind walking, it is just over a mile to the nearest T station (not the one the shuttle takes you to), so i avoided the crowded shuttle. Coming back to the hotel was not crowded at all. Breakfast was wonderful, a little more than usually expected. waffles each day, plus other hot foods (including eggs) the other day. not sure why eggs were not both days, but i was very late to eat that first day. If you have kids, there is a very nice city beach/playground just behind the hotel. If you are a runner/biker/walker it is on the developing harborwalk trail system, which i ran on each day i was there, felt safe and was very nice. If you are a person who sleeps lightly or who would be bothered by any of the issues listed in the reviews - STAY AWAY, you wont be happy here. But if none of these things are things that you are really concerned about, this is a great value hotel for Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the money”
Reviews.Author: Kaapeha
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights at this hotel and except for one night , had an enjoyable stay. The night in question was due to a large group of about 25 - 30 teenagers who checked in late and were loud, continuously knocking at each others' rooms, stomping and yelling the length of the hallways. Called the front desk to request that the group's chaperones be notified to settle their people down. Said they would but basically nothing changed till well past. midnight . That aside, unless you want to pay $350+ for a downtown hotel, this is a very good option. They provide a free shuttle to and from the airport. We waited an acceptable 20 minutes, after our call, for our pickup. The pickup location was across the immediate departure area of the airport and easy to find. We were joining a cruise and they also provided a free scheduled drop off to the cruise terminal. The hotel is located about three subway stops from the center of Boston and they also provide a shuttle to and from the Metro or "T" station. This shuttle runs about every 30 minutes but of particular note, the van can carry only about 20 people and serves not only the Comfort Inn but the Ramada Inn and as a consequence can fill quite quickly. There were a few occasions where people could not get on and had to wait 30 minutes for the next pickup with no assurance that they would be able to get on the next one. Think some kind of sign up system is needed. The rooms were clean and functional and unlike some other reviewers we didn't find traffic noise or any other external noises to be any problem at all, and we had a room facing the road. The free breakfast was very good and the selection was more than adequate. The immediate area does not have too many options for resturants. There is a resturant attached to a hotel (think it was a Ramada Inn) - the food was so so, but like some other reviewer mentioned, the service was abysmally slow. Eat in town before you return to the hotel unless you have time to burn. A sandwich shop, a Dunking Doughnut resturant and Bowling Alley Pizza place are closeby. There is also a large super market across the street with an attached deli. You can access the market through an overhead pedestrian walkway or a crosswalk with a traffic light immediately to the left and infront of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: Indiana08
Reviews.Content: The train line ran just outside our room. Internet connection was terrible in the room. The ice machine was adjacent to the room ( I think it was the only machine . People from other floors were getting ice at this machine). The elevator was just outside the door. The shuttle was slow and crowded when we rode it to and from the train station. The eating area was small. The rooms were past due for renovation.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid like the plague !!”
Reviews.Author: T-fal
Reviews.Content: Heed my warning...and stay away from this place. There is a major traffic route into downtown Boston, directly in front of this Hotel. (CAR AND TRUCK NOISE) The subway and deisel commuter trains run less than 100 feet behind the hotel. (TRAIN NOISE starting at 5am. and finishing at 1am). And my personal favorite, this hotel is directly in the landing path for Boston's Logan airport (AIRPLANE NOISE). Depending on the wind direction you can get over 1000 flights a day flying over this hotel at (get this), less than 1000 feet. We had everything from 747's to Piper cubs flying over our heads, from 5:30 am to well after midnight. If you are a glutton for punishment, then this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Cost efficient hotel near Logan Airport”
Reviews.Author: Londoner100
Reviews.Content: We wanted a hotel for 1 night near Logan airport as we were catching a flight early in the morning. This hotel was only a 10 min drive to the airport and the free airport shuttle every 30 minutes was great and very convenient. Breakfast was also free and available early which helped as we had an early flight . We had a twin queen bed room which was very spacious and the bathroom was nice. Room was a bit dated but reasonably clean and had all the basics. Had free WIFI and decent TV channels. The hotel also has a swimming pool which was a nice add on. Staff were friendly. This is a good budget hotel if you need somewhere near the airport for a short stay. If you want somewhere for sightseeing in Boston then it is a bit out of the way of downtown as it is 3 miles north east of the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Would Stay Here Again”
Reviews.Author: JackSwede
Reviews.Content: This is not the Ritz-Carlton as some reviewers seemed to want it to be. But, I had an experience nothing like the experience of the average reviews of this hotel. The rooms were clean, the staff was friendly, the shuttle to JFK/UMass station was 10 minutes late 1 time out of the 10 times we used it and the shuttle to the Airport was right on time at 6 am. Morning breakfast was your average waffles, bagels, muffins, cereal, fruit, yogurt, etc and yes at times it got busy, but I never found it too busy that I couldn't even eat. There is free wireless in the hotel lobby and if you don't have a laptop, you can use the internet for $7 for 30 minutes. I never did use it, so I don't know how good it is. There isn't a restaurant on the hotel grounds, but there is on the property. Confused? The Philips Family owns 4-5 properties within a 5 minute walk, so there are 2 restaurants a block from the Comfort Inn attached to the Ramada and also a pizzeria/cafe in the bowling alley that they own on the property. There is also a grocery store, Dunkin Donuts and a sub shop across the street from the Comfort Inn. How inconvenient! (sarcasm) It is about 20-25 minutes from downtown Boston, but don't let that discourage you from using this hotel. For $15.00 you can purchase a 7 day Charlie Card and use the Mass Transit unlimited (Bus, Subway..etc). It also takes the headache out of getting around the city. The most interchanges you would have to make from the hotel to any part of Boston was 1 using the T line. Overall, I would stay there again. The distance to Boston wasn't bad and for the price, you can't beat it. It is good for travelers that don't want to spend over $200 a night just to lay your head on a pillow. I used this hotel exactly what I needed it for, to sleep. Oh yeah, I believe it is a pet friendly hotel, so your four legged friends can stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Could have been too cosy!”
Reviews.Author: PebblesBob
Reviews.Content: The hotel provides a courtesy bus from Logan Airport but as there is more than one Comfort Inn in Boston, ask the driver to which hotel he is going. We ended up at the wrong one and had to be taken back to the airport where the correct bus was waiting. We had a problem on arrival - we were told we had booked only one room and two double beds for four adults (two couples) for two nights. A bit too cosy for our liking. When we explained we had booked two rooms and showed paperwork givng an overall price of $600, the guy on the reception was still adament that we had booked only one room. And, we were told they were fully booked so another room wasn't available. It wasn't until we produced a copy of an email that confirmed the two room booking that further investigation was done and another room was found. Apparently not their fault but Venere who we had booked through. Moral of the story - take copies of paperwork. The hotel is basic but clean. Coffee facilities in the rooms. Good breakfast - freshly made waffles, fruit, yoghurt, muffins, coffee, juice - in a reasonably sized room. A shuttle to and from the nearest subway station to get in to Boston is provided. If returning to the airport, book your place on the shuttle as they fill up. Try the Phillips Restaurant about five minutes walk away (next to the Ramada Hotel) for excellent, reasonably priced food. The chocolate shop on the way back is too tempting.

Reviews.Title: “What a mistake - we booked two nights”
Reviews.Author: Minako
Reviews.Content: My friend and I started and ended our mini New England tour in this hotel. What a mistake . The rooms were noisey ( we could hear next doors air con and the metro line behind us all night). There is no evening food available in this place but if you walked 5 minutes down the road there is a pretty good inn for food. The breakfasts were just awfull, it was cramped self service and over crowded. The most classic touch was the breakfast plastic cultery and paper plates. Dont stay at this place.

Reviews.Title: “Bad choice”
Reviews.Author: mountain_girl01
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed only one night at this hotel, and we won't be staying there again. We arrived at Boston Airport at about 1.30pm and called for the shuttle bus. It took almost 20 mins to arrive, but the driver wouldn't take us and suggested we call for another shuttle bus. He gave no explanation for this behaviour. Another shuttle bus arrived about 5 minutes later and we got on but had to wait another 15 minutes for some other passengers. Then the driver had to pick up several more people from various locations, and the entire journey took nearly an hour (not the advertised 20 minutes). The room was ok, but a bit noisy. The hotel is on the flight path, has a very busy road on one side and a railway track on the other. There is nothing close to the hotel apart from a supermarket, and all the restaurants etc are at the Ramada Hotel down the road. We didn't feel like walking around the area as it looked a bit seedy, so we ordered take-away pizza from the nearby bowling alley. Breakfast would have been ok except that there was a tour group having breakfast when we were there and it was very crowded and there were long lines for the food. We booked for the 10am shuttle bus to the airport and it didn't arrive until 10.20am. I think there are better hotels than this one.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: demc152
Reviews.Content: All the amenitites listed, which is why we chose this hotel, are at the Ramada Inn that is located down the road. We had looked forward to using the pool and going to the lounge after a long day of sightseeing. While you are allowed to use these as a guest of the Comfort Inn, it is an unsavory walk in the daytime - just plain scary at night. We had reserved a queen bed - got a double. Front desk was no help. We were told that when a room is reserved, it does not have to be the kind that is requested. Huh? Wouln't recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “quite adequate for us!”
Reviews.Author: irishtraveller32
Reviews.Content: this hotel was fine for us. the shuttle from the airport was fantastic - just call them when you land and they'll send it straight away. the shuttle to the subway station was great too - but as mentioned before it can get full and you have to wait until the next one sometimes - not much fun after a long day walking around boston! the first night we arrived we were pretty jet lagged, and about midnight there was a lot of noise in the corridor from a group of teenagers running up and down. i called the reception and within minutes they had sent security up to quieten them down. overall, was fine, a bit expensive though - $340 for two nights midweek including tax etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: NDMartin
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel to stay in whilst visiting Boston, although a little bit out of the city a free shuttle runs every 15mins to and from the subway atation during the day and every half hour at night. If you want to get somewhere at a time when the shuttle is not running all you have to do is ask and they will put it on for you, we were picked up from the airport at about 11pm on arrival and were dropped at the subway station at about 6am on the day of our departure. The hotel was very nice and clean, there was a free breakfast in the morning and there was internet access though it cost about $7 per half hour. There was also a small gym in the hotel for use of residents. There are no restaurants around the hotel but there is a bowling alley which offers take away pizza. The only problem with this hotel was the shuttle is sometimes overcrowded and not everyone can get on, however it is never long before the next one comes along.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: sophMontreal
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated a little out of town. If you're traveling by car, it's fine. For 90$/night, parking, breakfast and tax included, it's quite cheap for the Boston area. There's a free shuttle to the subway. The included breakfast is decent and the area has lots of space to sit people. When booking your room, ask for one facing away from the train tracks. The staff at the desk were very polite and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “A bit far out of Boston”
Reviews.Author: poshcatlady
Reviews.Content: This hotel was o.k. but a bit far out of town. There is a free shuttle service to the locat train station, and also free airport transfers which is very good, but i probably wouldn't stay there again as i would want to be nearer the centre of Boston. Free breakfast is adequate, and the staff are very nice, especially Ric, who sorted out a problem we had checking in as our booking had gone missing. Room was nice, This hotel is probably ideal for a short stay rather than a holiday.

Reviews.Title: “OK for the price”
Reviews.Author: BarnetBlackDog
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night in September 2006 as it was a good deal cheaper than staying in downtown Boston. A cab from downtown will cost around $20 inc tip and I would advise this rather than public transport as the area around is a little bit random. Location notwithstanding we had a nice clean room with a good shower and what looked like an OK breakfast (I didn't have time) for $130. The check-in staff were helpful and there was a plentiful supply of courtesy buses. I would say useful if you need to keep costs down but otherwise a bit far out.

Reviews.Title: “Good experience”
Reviews.Author: thaus76
Reviews.Content: Let me first say that I am rating this hotel as compared to other hotels of similar caliber. As a 3-star hotel, I felt that the Comfort Inn was a very good value. It was certainly priced well below other hotels of similar ranking in the area, and the free parking, free continental breakfast, and free shuttle to the subway probably saved us another $50/day over hotels in Boston's downtown areas. The front desk staff was courteous, and since we arrived late in the evening they gave us a free room upgrade as the last available room was between the elevator and ice machine, and the hotel staff did not want to put us there (nice of them, I thought.) The room was perfectly nice, nothing fancy but clean and tastefully decorated. The subway line runs behind the building, and can be noisy at night if you are a light sleeper so maybe request a room at the front of the hotel. The shuttle to the "T" station ran every half hour, and we never had an excessive wait. There really isn't anything nearby as far as restaurants or attractions (save for the "on-property" restaurants and bowling alley) so one pretty much has to get on the "T" to get to almost anything. The "on-property" restaurants were nice enough, although it depends on what your definintion of "on-property" is. It is about a 2 block walk to the Ramada Inn, which is where the restaurants, bowling alley, AND THE COMFORT INN's POOL are. The area seems safe enough during the day, but I was very nervous walking from the restaurant back to the hotel at night as the area is a bit industrial and not well lit. The walk is especially bothersome if you plan on using the pool, unless you want to take clothes with you and change at the Ramada. In fact, I never used the pool becuase of this inconvenience. The continental breakfast was very good. Belgian waffles, cereal, and bagels/muffins/ toast, and fruit if you get up early enough to get it. This hotel seems to cater to a very international and family-oriented crowd. But, if you have kids who want to use the "entertainment complex" you might want to consider the Ramada instead to eliminate the walk. Overall, I would recommend this hotel for anyone who wants a nice hotel at a good price. It is not the Ritz, but for a 3-star hotel it was more than adequate.

Reviews.Title: “OK but...what you should know...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our stay at Comfort Inn Boston on Morrisey. At first was concerned about the rail line was just outside our room but when we set the A/C to Fan it did mostly drowned out the noise. Wasn't the problem it appeared it would be at first. Restaurants and pool several blocks way was very misleading when you look at their website it sounds like they are on property. It was a very good restaurant overall but the walk was more than we expected. It rained while we were there so could have been a problem. Staff was friendly but some of the information that gave about Trolley, times of scheduled shuttles, tourist info was not totally accurate. Didn't create big problem but could have been better. The housekeepers did not have a good grasp of stocking and cleaning in room coffee makers. Every night of our stay we had to go get cups, sugar, cream and even coffee for the next morning. Not very pleasing when you are tired and ready for bed. Coffee in the room was important to us and after telling them it wasn't serviced correctly the first night was shocked every night for 4 nights it was no better. Overall the room was clean, staff pleasant, and stay was nice. We had a good deal so the price was good and found it to be an OK place to stay. With just a few minor adjustments and a more accurate description on their website might improve others view of stay.

Reviews.Title: “Out of the way hotel”
Reviews.Author: rob_hanson1979
Reviews.Content: When arriving in Boston South Station, we took a taxi to this hotel because of our luggage. The website leads you to believe it is conveniently located on the outskirts of downtown, but it is not. It is much further. Our taxi fare was over $25, and that was with NO traffic to delay us. Once we arrived at the hotel, our room was not ready, so the man at the front desk stored our luggage for us. We mentioned we would be spending the day downtown, and he didn't mention the free shuttle to the subway station. We were going to walk all the way to the subway station(and it is far) but fortunately, the woman at Dunkin Donuts told us about the free shuttle offered by OUR hotel. We went back to the hotel, and took the shuttle. After spending the day in downtown Boston, we returned to the hotel, checked in, and asked for our luggage. The new front desk clerk couldn't find it anywhere. It turns out the morning clerk stored it in a different location than they usually store luggage, but didn't tell anyone. Our room was clean and large. It was comfortable and the bathroom was large. Keep in mind that half the rooms in this hotel are right next to the subway tracks, so you will have trains going by all night. Light sleepers may be bothered by this. While there are some restaurants and shops within walking distance, the roads are very unfriendly for pedestrians, with no crosswalks and curves everywhere. I would be wary of wandering around in what seemed like an unsafe industrial area. So to sum up, the free shuttle to the subway make it a decent hotel to stay at if you want to save some money by avoiding downtown hotels, but the location is not a good feature of this hotel. Plus the customer service by the staff is slightly less than satisfactory. I would stay here again for the rates as you can easily take the Subway downtown. However, if you book, please know what you are getting.

Reviews.Title: “OK for price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Comfort Inn Boston as the cost was reasonable in comparison to most Boston hotels. The hotel sent a complementary shuttle bus to pick us up from the airport, which was really helpful. The hotel room was clean and comfortable. I had no difficulty with internet wireless access on my laptop in the hotel and this was complementary. Breakfast was included in cost also, which consisted of fresh waffles, muffins, bread, coffee, yogurt, fruit juice etc. I thought that this was good value as other 'better hotels' had charged us for all of the above, additional to our room rate, and the service was no better than the Comfort Inn Boston. On the downside, it is hard to believe that this hotel is advertised as part of a complex containing restaurants. It is a shorter walk to Dunkin' Donuts and the supermarket opposite the hotel than to the 'restaurants' on-site. There is a railway behind the hotel and though I occasionally heard some noise, it wasn't bad enough to cause any great problems.
